content.description: Sart on nice jugs beside arete. Make your way out the obvious holds to the tree and mantle out.
content.protection: A couple of pads and spotters.
content.location: Fartherest problem to the left on Indian Roof.

content.description: Sit start. Climb up and left. Climb arete to the top.
content.location: To the right of the old tin shelter.

content.description: Start on greasy seam just left of red arrow. Make your way to seam then out through jugs.

This aptly-named problem climbs a series of aesthetic pockets and scoops in the honeycombed Wasp boulder. Starting low, move left and up to a hard move into a dish. Finish more easily up the pockmarked slab to a high topout. Many say that the downclimb is the crux; ignore them and scoot down the far side of the boulder using a tree.
content.protection: Several pads. There's a gnarly root below the start.
content.location: Opposite High Life, near the lookout. Very obvious honeycombed boulder.

content.description: Start on a low jug. Climb up the groove to a slopey mantle.
content.location: The High Life Boulder.

content.description: SDS very low matched on good jug. Make a tough, strength dependent move up to an undercling (many consider this to be the crux) then continue up the steep face and top out at the upper left corner.
content.protection: A couple pads and a spotter.
content.location: Just behind the Slider boulder in the direction of the High Life area.

content.description: Sit start under small roof. Move out to the right and climb obvious jugs to the top.
content.location: Turtle Rock Area. Look for Turtle Rock sign.

content.description: Sit start under small roof. Move out to the left and climb jugs to the top.
content.location: Turtle Rock Area. Look for Turtle Rock sign.

content.description: Stand start. Climb slopers with double water grooves to the top.   Note: If you can do Millipede, you can do this one.
content.protection: pads and couple of good spotters
content.location: Skywalker Area: Past Millipede, go on top of Millipede boulder and enter the small corridor. Problem on left.

content.description: Left arete on cool lay-backy, bulby holds.   Fun v0 warm-up on cool holds with a relatively easy topout. Start on this and Lob first thing in the morning. This is the slightly harder of the two.
content.location: In the Out of the Box area, just about visible from Millipede. Look for a clean face with good holds in the center (Lob), and this problem on the left side.

content.description: Start on jug under roof, long move to good hold then up on tiny crimps.
Stand start on side pull.  Climbs grooves to a slopey top out.
content.location: On the back of the boulder in front of the Millipede boulder.  Facing away from Bum Boy.  To the right of Orchid on the same face.

content.description: Start on jugs. Traverse low right to the start of slider and finish on slider.
content.location: Slider boulder

content.description: Stand start. Start on crimps, climb out roof. Being Tall helps.
content.location: Flat Roof Boulder, between Lou-ser and Crisfix.

content.description: Jump start to edges, slap left to dish and mantle hard /on an overhanging boulder
content.location: Roadside Boulders/Shelter Boulders, big promenant overhang.

content.description: Stand start. Start in low break. Climb arete. Pad edge stage.
content.location: To the right of the big stage, behind little speaker stage.

content.description: Awesome sloper pawing up a short, steep wall, with a technical sloper topout. So, yeah, a pretty typical HP40 high quality rig. Feel good about sending this one.
content.location: Supa Coola area, far left side of the Five-O, Odd Job, Skeletor boulder.

content.description: Interesting climbing on fun pockets defines this short problem. Start low and right in the cave on a good jug. Post feet and bust left to a good 3-finger pocket (crux). Cross or bump through to another 3-finger, then move up to an excellent pinch between two more pockets. From here, follow a good slopey rail to its end, and step off onto the boulder behind you. Warning: the problem is a bit contrived. There is a fantastic jug out left of the pockets, and the step-off is less than smooth. Fun nonetheless, if only for the first four moves.
content.protection: Several pads, as a fall could send you crashing against the boulder behind the climb
content.location: In the Cadillac Thrills area, to the left of Red Arrow in a small slot/cave that leads through to the Cave Traverse. Prominent short, pocketed face that begs to be climbed.

content.description: A cool little 1-2 move start added to the totally decent v3 Spandex Ballet. Start seated with hands on decent shallow slopers, place high right foot, and work your way up to the right to the starting right hand jug on Spandex Ballet. Finish on that problem with delicate use of the slopers and pinches.
content.protection: 1-2 pads. Actually kind of a dangerous landing for a fall from Spandex Ballet, with the boulder there.
content.location: Uphill side of Cadillac Thrills.

content.description: Sit start under arête. Climb out of roof and along arête on decent holds.
content.location: The Middle/Skywalker area. Near Genesis and Mistaken Identity. To the right of Enough.

content.description: Start on jugs. Climb seam and slopers to huge jugs at the top.
content.location: Light Post boulders.

content.description: Pocket problem! Start on jugs and go up sharp pockets to a topout.
content.protection: A pad or 2 and a good spotter
content.location: Its in the alley left of The Crown. You cant miss the pockets. Start on the low jugs.

content.description: Sit start low w/ right crimp and left back handed edge. Difficult moves to original start to slider, and finish with slider.
content.location: Slider Boulder

content.description: Sit start on low jug and trend right via crmps and slopers through arete to top.
content.protection: A couple of pads, one for the slide boulder and noe at the bottom. and good spotter.
content.location: Slider Boulder

content.description: Sit start on furtherest end and trend right to hard break to hard cross through move in the center of face, then continue to  the top via hp slopers!
content.protection: a couple of pads and spotters!
content.location: Skywalker area around the corner from Genesis.

content.description: Sit start on low slopey edge. Climb the seam.
content.location: Shelter Boulders. Accross from Indian Kitchen.

content.description: Start left of Genesis on the jug rail. Climb straight up into a slot, then a pinch and a sloper and save some for the mantle.
content.location: Left of Genesis (V3)

content.description: Stand start. Climb face.
content.location: Around the corner from Red Arrow.

content.description: Sit start on low edges. Do a Iron cross to the left for a good hold and then continue up face/crack.
content.location: Front of the lookout point boulder. Look for obvious crack.

content.description: Start low on good holds. Work your way up to a sloper/mantle HP40 topout.
content.location: Around the side from Stretch Armstrong and Crisifix. Next to the painted red arrow.

content.description: Nice big boulder with a red arrow on front, another classic must do!!
content.location: Cadillac Thrills Boulders area.

content.description: Start on good holds with a high right foot, and shoot straight up through more good stuff until you hit the topout at just 6 feet. Low to medium technical topout, and a safe fall make this a great topout trainer. Good stone.
content.location: Follow the face left around the corner from Ticket Home and Lob to find this chalked up and much loved, if brief, rig.

content.description: Start on good holds, move to bad sloping crimp, bring up right foot and snag the jug. Set up feet and execute a very long move to the sloping lip. Then typical HP40 top-out. Holds on left side of arete are off.
content.protection: Two pads. One for the rock below you and one behind it in case you helicopter off going for the lip. One spotter is enough
content.location: Slider Boulders area. Uniball boulder is to your left, and slider boulder is to your right.

content.description: A series of great sloper moves up a featured groove make this problem, tucked away from the main parts of HP, an underrated classic. Sidepull your way up the Bum Boy-like slopers using technical footwork.
content.location: Near HP Canyon, on the other side of the boulder that faces Millipede. Walk through the corridor directly away from Millipede and turn right. Orchid is the dark face on the right. Walk off.

content.description: Stand start on good edges. With right hand go up for sloper and work off slopers to the left and top out.
content.location: Supa Coola area. Down the corridor past Dope, double groove, and past Supa Coola look for problem on the left. Obvious round, smooth boulder.

content.description: Orange Slice is an anomalous problem at Horse Pens. Instead of climbing on low-angle slopers, the route follows a slightly overhung crimp line. Starting low in a crack/pocket (you can also move in from a crack on the left at the same grade), climb a series of almost identical thin, incut crimps. The line is obvious, and trends towards an obvious two-hand slopey pocket. Hold it together for one last long move off a sidepull to a jug on a horizontal feature. Traverse right and drop off.
content.protection: Several pads. Falling on the last move could mean trouble.
content.location: Climbs the first 18 feet of one of the large outcrops in the Turtle Rock area. From the campsite, locate a nice orange face to the left of Growing Stone, Boy Scout Crack etc. Probably the closest problem to the showerhouse.

content.description: Start in cave on huge pod. Long move leads to bread loaf hold then out left to face. Funky moves lead to sloping dish up and left.
Sit start low on jug. With your left reach for a pocket.  Then to slopey edges. Climb zi-zag face.
content.location: Flat Roof Boulder Area.

content.description: Never Trust a Mustache climbs a tall face on sloping pockets and an interesting crack feature. A rather strange, but quite good problem that requires ample strength and technique. Start on a shelf and move rightward through slopey pod crimps to a long move up and right to a good hold. Follow a crack with face holds to a small ledge, then an easy but very high low-angle topout.
content.protection: Pad or two. If you're not comfortable on the topout, you probably weren't good enough to do the problem in the first place.
content.location: On the same boulder as Cadillac Thrills, on the opposite side from the camping area. If you're on the Bridge Arete bridge and look towards the cave, you'll see it on the right.

content.description: Campus start (or very high feet) on solid holds. Work your way up to a typical HP40 topout. Kind of a taller boulder, so a spotter is recommended.
content.location: Flat Roof Boulder. Two lines to the right of Red Arrow 2 (aka Little Red Arrow). On the backside of the Stretch Armstrong/Crisifix boulder.

content.description: Start with wide hands on high compression slopers. Work your way up until you can mantle.  Lots of compression (and forearm cheese-grating...)
content.location: The Middle/Skywalker area. If you're looking away from Genesis, it's on your left about 20 feet away. It's immediately to the right of Cullman 4, from the guidebook, but it's not actually in the guidebook.

content.description: Easy high slab. Stand start on the small jugs and walk up the slab, top out on the jugs.
content.protection: Stack some pads and get a potter or 2
content.location: If you were to top out Bumboy, right in front of you you will see a boulder formed alley, on the left side, the Skywalker side, you will see it.

content.description: A right-arching sloper problem that starts down in a hole.  Must smear feet/no foot holds, boulder on left is off.
content.location: Cadillac Thrills area

content.description: Statr on left-slanting edge. Long move left to horizontal pinch then out roof to jug.
Warm-up! This and Ticket Home are great v0s to get the blood pumping first thing in the morning. Great rock, good movement, good landings. This is the easier of the two.
content.location: In the Out of the Box Area, which is just about visible when you are standing at Millipede. Look for a 12-14 ft face with good holds.

content.description: Climb out shallow pockets with the tree behind you. Top out as Boomslang and Cuts Like A Knife.
Crimpy traverse. Start on micro crimps and traverse right on micro crimps, once you get to a jug (from a distant crimp) top her OUT.
content.protection: Get a pad were you might fall, or a spotter to drag it were you go.
content.location: Flat Roof Boulder! The crimpy start is in between Stretch Armstrong and Crusifix. Go down via the alley near the end or Lou-Ser

content.description: Sit start. From jugs, move to lip, traverse right, and mantle.
content.location: Out of the Box area.

content.description: SDS with right hand in obvious large pocket & left on edge. Move up past some cool opening moves to reach a shallow right hand pocket. Figure out how to stabilize in the pocket and make the long move to the good hold up and left (crux). Keep your head together for a rather difficult mantle.
content.location: Obvious problem just around the corner left of "High Life"

content.description: stand start and continue to mantle.
content.location: Slider Boulders/Lady Slipper boulder

content.description: This improbable line climbs a tall, harder-than-V2-looking overhanging bulge. Starting sitting at the edge of a low roof on good crimps, make a big move to a positive iron seam. Match, then move left to a sidepull pocket before matching above on a flat hold. Make another large move to a pocket out right, then up and left to a thank-god flake. Climb the flake to a high and slightly tricky topout.
content.location: The route is located in the High Life area near the lookout, directly opposite The Crown. Find a steep overhang near the entrance to a narrow corridor and you're there. Downclimb the back of the boulder using a tree.

content.description: Start on juggy rail.  Long move to pocket.  Finish up face
content.location: High Life Boulder

content.description: Climb jugs to the right of Trick or Treat.
content.location: Skywalker area. To the right of Trick or Treat.

content.description: Stand start and climb face.
content.location: Shelter Boulders. Accross from the Indian Kitchen.

content.description: Filthy sad garbage slab. Start on slopers, stand on lichen, reach up to slopers, stand on more lichen, and then stab to the jugs above the bulge.
content.protection: 1 pad to protect the rocky, rooty landing.
content.location: On the Cadillac Thrills boulder, on the uphill side, on the little wall that also holds Spandex Ballet. Look for the scummy licheny slab between two runnels on the right side of the face.

content.description: Stand start on break. Left hand on small crimper. move feet up and go for pocket in roof weakness (Giant flake), left hand on left side of flake and go for big jug/lip. Once you snag it, heel hook right and traverse out past water groove to big jug up about two feet, exit stage left.
content.protection: A couple of pads and spotters.
content.location: Large roof shelter about 50 ft. left of Genesis.

content.description: Stand start on flake in the very back of Indian Roof shelter. Climb out huge flake to the start of Indian Roof and finish.
content.location: Center of Indian Roof.

content.description: Stand start on big break. Campus up to next break and exit stage left. ( same exit as Indian Roof Right)
content.protection: A couple of pads protecting you from the slab under this problem. Spotters.
content.location: About 6 ft. left of I.R.Right.

content.description: Stand start. Slab climb. Caution with the top.
content.location: Natural Boulder.

content.description: stand start on jug, climb arete.
content.location: Flat Roof Boulder

content.description: Sit start low on jug. Move to the right edge the to sloper. A long reach gets you to another sloper, then a nice mantle. Stay off the big jug to the right, as it isn't part of the problem.
content.location: High Life Boulder. Between Another Litz and Lawdog.

content.description: Sit start.  climb fartest right of lady slipper face
content.location: Lady Slipper Boulder

content.description: Start down and right of Green Lantern on small crimps. Big move left to jug and traverse into Green Lantern.
Sit start. Make some reachy moves to a slopey rail and bump to the top. Note: Hit the rail high as you can for the best part of it.
content.location: Washout Boulders. On the left as you enter the wash.

content.description: Sit start. Start on crimps and move up to slpoey arete. Sqeeze tight to the top.
content.location: HP Canyon. Take dirt road down into canyon, and hug the boulders around to the right. Great White will be on the right.

content.description: Sit start very low on pockets. Continue with hard moves up the face.
content.location: The High life Boulder: walking towards the lookout point.

content.description: one of the hardest problems at hp40, Stand start on crimpers(no jumping!)paste foot on wall,then go to crimps on seam, continue to top!! Good Luck!!
content.location: Slider Boulders/Lady slipper Boulder

content.description: Start matched on small edge. Move to pocket and match on it. Move right for crux mantle move.
content.location: Washout Boulders. Around to the right from Green Lantern.

content.description: Sit start on low shelf.  Traverse right to good sidepull, then straight up on slopers.
content.location: The High life boulder.

content.description: Start on jugs and mix around on the MEAN slopers to a topout.
content.location: On the back side of the Shelter Boulder thats sorta walled in. Start on the low jugs.

content.description: The first problem established at Horse Pens. Often tried, and fun to climb with a group helping to figure out the beta. Stand start on enormous underclings. Make a long move to a slopey pod that is easy to stick but hard to move off of. Move up left to a decent sloper or right (further) to a slopey jug. Mantle.
content.location: At the end of the main area, near Skywalker and Dinosaur Rock. Genesis faces the Cadillac Thrills area and the bridge. Downclimb just right of the problem.

content.description: Stand start. Climb the face.
content.location: Cadillac Thrills Boulder.

content.description: Eight Ball climbs a slightly overhanging face on pockets and jugs (including the eponymous '8' pocket) to a reachy Horse Pens topout. Start low, and on the topout, sift through the assortment of less-than-ideal holds to find the one that will allow you to pull right to a jug.
content.protection: Pad(s)& spotters, the landing is slightly down hill.
content.location: In the High Life area, on the first boulder reached on the right after leaving the end of the campsite area. Walk past the port-a-john and you will shortly see it on the right. Eight Ball climbs the most featured part of the face, and is surrounded by similar V2s.

content.description: Climb the friction slab in the pit directly behind Man with the Slow Hand.  Excellent movement and a bit scary right at the top.
content.protection: Stuff a crashpad in the pit but be sure to leave the good starting foot ledge exposed.

content.description: Sit start on okay holds.  As you move up and right, the holds get better.  Continue up the arete to the top out.
content.location: Ten Pins Boulders.  Next to Mariachi.

content.description: Sit start. Match hands on nasty sloper. Mak a hard move  gets you to a jug at the bottom of a crack. Climb jugs to the top.
content.location: To the right of the old tin roof shelter.

content.description: About 7 feet left of Slider, SDS on a low jug and move more or less straight up using a razor-sharp crimp on the face.  Hit the juggy break then hand traverse up and right until its end.  A subtle sidepull and jug out right will set you up for the classic sloper topout.
content.protection: A couple of pads and a spotter is a good idea as the topout is not trivial.

content.description: Sit start. Start on arete to face on the right of the arete.
content.location: Sun Wall.  Big orange face on the left right before you get to flat roof boulder.

content.description: Stand start.Short jump up to marked faint footholds ( this will be a deadpoint ). Ease left on small dishes to a sloping edge. A long reach gets the top out.
content.location: Skywalker area. Shares a small corridor wth Merlin.   Other side of Millipede.

content.description:
The Crown refers to the final hold of the climb, a bulbous knob that you will learn to love. To reach it, sit start low in an awkward pocket with slippery feet. Depending on your height, moving off of this could be the crux (tall people will have trouble here, short people at the top). Move up and left to a good sidepull pocket with a thumb catch. Right hand then goes up to a similar hold. After two more similar sidepull moves, establish feet and pull on hard for the crown. Top out easily. 

  This problem is enjoyable because you are constantly shifting your weight across the face while using the various sidepulls. The final deadpoint, while intimidating, is fairly straightforward.
content.protection: Several pads. The final move is somewhat high off the deck.
content.location: The Crown is nearly the closest problem to the lookout. It is located near the entrance to a narrow corridor, across from Wa Wa Wa. Descend the back of the boulder.

content.description: Start low. Long move into a mantle top out
content.location: Eight Ball boulder. To the left of Eight Ball problem.

content.description: Sit start on jugs right of Lady Slipper.  Climb bulbous face.
content.location: Lady Slipper Boulder

content.description: AWESOME! Sit-Start in back of cave on jug. Follow jugs to shelf 20 feet left. Step off.
content.location:
Cadillac Thrills Boulders, Roadside Boulders 

  Near a wooden bridge in a cave.

content.description: Start almost with a campus and get a high left foot on solid jib. Move up crack to nice holds up top.
content.location: Cadillac Thrills Area. Immediately to the left of Cadillac Thrills. Obvious crack.

content.description: Start with the jug under the roof. Reach for a tiny crimp. Climb face to finish through groove.
content.location: Cadillac Thrills Boulders: From Indian Kitchen, walk accross draw towards camp loop road and this big boulder is on left.

content.description: Face climb inside corridor.
content.location: Corridor between the Crown boulder & The Highlife boulder.

content.description: Stand start. Climb up the easy face to top-out with a mantle.
content.location: Out of the Box area.

content.description: Another great squeeze problem. East for the grade.    stand start, surf to high sloping side pulls then squeeze your way continuously to better holds.
content.protection: PADS there was a lot of leaves under us, very easy to twist an ankle.
content.location: Climb down the V0 in the front of the boulder

content.description: Sit start. Climb slopey face.
content.location: The front side of the lookout point boulder. Trail on left side or right.

content.description: This clean, white arete is another underrated classic moderate of HP40. Start sitting on good sidepull jugs on either side of the arete. Stand up and reach for a hold on the arete, then a decent sidepull pod above and to the left. Moving your feet up, reach towards the upper part of the slopey arete. If you stick this sloper move, it's an easy reach to a good knob atop the arete and a simple topout.
content.protection: Pad, as a fall onto the bridge is possible.
content.location: The arete rises alongside its namesake bridge, which in turn is on the trail from Cadillac Thrills to Elephant Rock. Walking from Genesis to Slider will also take you right past it.

content.description: Freaky mantle time. Start low on the jug, traverse up left to another jug, and go to the high crimps and topout on them.
content.location: At the far left of the Eight Ball Boulder. The big (chalked up) jug is the start. Go down the grove.

content.description: This is the slab problem just right of the downclimb tree.  Stand start and work your way to the large undercling/sloper halfway up the slab.  Slabby move to top out.  Do not lean to hard on the downclimb tree to the left.  It is not very solid.
content.location: Point Boulders, The High Life Boulder

content.description: Stand start on low crimps, campus to groove. Climb groove via, holds on right side of groove. traversing left isn't on.
content.location: Flat Roof area

content.description: Sit start on jugs.  Move up and mantle at the top.
content.location: the rond boulder between Lady Slipper and Flat Top Boulder

content.description: Easy face climbing.
content.location: down & left of the wheel well/ left of the point.

content.description: 100% crimper problem. Start on crimps, and go up on crimps.
content.protection: A spotter with a pad or two
content.location: The front of the Shelter Boulder. It's in what looks like a huge groove. Start on the flakey crimp and go straight up.

content.description: Stand start. Get set, and make a huge Dyno out to roof lip.
content.location: 4 ft. right of I.R.Right.

content.description: this is a holding area for routes being assigned to sub-areas
